hints.content:
Each shelf has $\purpleC9$ books.

There are $\greenD{45}$ total books.

[[☃ image 1]]

How many $\blueD{\text{groups}}$ are there?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of unequal lengths, a first tape labeled 45 and a shorter second tape with one part labeled 9. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the first tape is labeled with a question mark and the words equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}\times\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} = \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\purpleC9\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{45}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}=\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} $

So, $\greenD{45}\div \purpleC9=\blueD{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many shelves are on the bookcase are:

 - $\purpleC9\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{45}$
 - $\greenD{45}\div \purpleC9=\blueD{\text{?}}$

question.content:
There are $45$ books on the bookcase in Riya's bedroom.  Each shelf on the bookcase has $9$ books.   

**Which equations would help us find out how many shelves are on the bookcase?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
